title: Multiply by $$1$$
text: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1; write $$1$$ as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.
speech: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1: write  1  as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.
pacedSpeech: The first step is to multiply the measurement to be converted by 1 write   1
as a fraction relating the units given and the units needed.

title: Relating Feet to Inches
text: The conversion from feet to inches is $$1$$ $$foot=12$$ inches.
speech: The conversion from feet to inches is , 1   foot, is equal to 12  inches.
pacedSpeech: The conversion from feet to inches is  , 1

title: Writing $$1$$ as a Fraction
text: Using the relation between feet and inches, we can rewrite the $$1$$ we multiply in the first step as (12 inches)/(1 feet), so we get the expression $$6$$ feet*(12 inches)/(1 feet).
speech: Using the relation between feet and inches, we can rewrite the  1  we multiply in the first step as (12 inches)/(1 feet), so we get the expression  6  feet*(12 inches)/(1 feet).
pacedSpeech: Using the relation between feet and inches, we can rewrite the   1
we multiply in the first step as (12 inches)/(1 feet), so we get the expression   6

title: Simplifying
text: Feet divides out, so we get the expression 6*(12 inches)/1.
speech: Feet divides out, so we get the expression 6*(12 inches)/1.
pacedSpeech: Feet divides out, so we get the expression 6*(12 inches)/1.

title: Multiplying
text: Multiply the expression, we get the final answer $$72$$ inches
speech: Multiply the expression, we get the final answer  72  inches
pacedSpeech: Multiply the expression, we get the final answer   72
